Cops, man in shootout in Southie

A man being investigated for illegal drug sales allegedly opened fire on Boston police officers today, prompting police to return fire and shoot the man in the chest, authorities said. (2:54 p.m.)
  • Pictures Scenes from a shootout involving police, drug suspect in South Boston

Ex-banker pleads not guilty in theft case

Elaina Patterson, 53, is accused of swindling more than $2 million from her relatives and elderly customers at a Bank of America branch in Reading. (2:43 p.m.)

Aaron Hernandez adjusts to jail life

Inmate No. 174594 — formerly No. 81 on the Patriots — Aaron Hernandez, is not just in prison. He is confined to a "special management unit" at the Bristol County House of Correction in North Dartmouth.

A not-guilty plea was entered on behalf of Robert Marley, 54, of Lynnfield after being arrested at the Squire Lounge in Revere, an official said. (3 p.m.)

room for G-rated films

Unrest in Middle East
pushes gas cost higher

Even with increased domestic production, gasoline prices are soaring again because of political troubles halfway around the world.
Opinion | Farah Stockman

Florida’s unjust gun laws

Florida is one of the worst places to fire a gun into the air, even as it appears to be one of the best places to actually shoot at a person.
